title: Kourtney Kardashian hacked and robbed of $5,200 by ex employee
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

While sister Kim Kardashian has her own Met Gala dramas to deal with, Kourtney Kardashian almost comes face-to-face with a thief who stole $5,200 from her.

To make matters worse, the reality star seemed to know who the culprit was and has even left the lady in question alone with her kids Mason, Penelope and Reign.

The former employee of the eldest Kardashian sister even went as far as to hack into the 40-year-old’s phone to snoop through her text messages.

Advertisement

Advertisement

In the latest episode of Keeping Up With The Kardashians the mum-of-three is faced with the horrifying reality that she is being robbed after money and iPads go missing from her Calabasas home.

Piecing together the crime with sister Khloe, Kourt reveals: ‘This lady stole $700 out of my wallet, then she stole $4,500 out of Scott’s.

‘Then my security, who’s here today, just said he’s seen her two times with her flashlight on in the office.’

Kourtney’s reported thief had been left alone with her children and children (Picture: Instagram)

The star then exclaimed: ‘She’s never coming here again,’ to which Khloe replied: ‘No s***, Sherlock’.

As if the news of being robbed by the housekeeper wasn’t bad enough, Kourtney’s informant, Stephanie, then revealed that the woman in question ‘also hacked everything’.

‘She’s looking at your texts right now,’ the star read loudly, adding: ‘She’s looking at my texts?’

Whilst being hacked before your very eyes is scary enough, Kourtney adds even more spook to the pot by revealing that the unnamed woman was downstairs in her house as the whole mess was being uncovered.

The woman allegedly walked off with $5,200 (Picture: Getty)

Urging her sister to ‘stand her ground’ Khloe rushed Kourtney downstairs just in time to see the woman in question’s car screech off, leaving her with big questions for security.

After ex-partner Scott Disick arrived, the team tried and pick up the pieces by changing passwords and debugging the house, declaring that it’s ‘a huge lesson’ that must be learnt for next time and that at least the kids weren’t harmed.

Advertisement

Advertisement

The episode luckily ends with the culprit being caught and Kourtney filing an official police report before cleansing the house with sage from any bad energy.

‘Bye bye, bad energy! Bye bye (Picture: E!)

Joined by Kris Jenner and Khloe, the trio reflected on the robbery events with Kourtney making a vow to move on.

‘I don’t dwell on things,’ she said.

In another interview the KUWTK star uttered the same sentiment adding: ‘I obviously can’t change what happened, but like anything in life, I believe that this is a big learning lesson… I just want to start fresh and get this bad energy out.’

Keeping Up With the Kardashians returns next Sunday at 9pm on E!
